issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Walkash on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three mural elements, crown cap; crescent, above covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below crescent, pointing upwards, double pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing behind right shoulder; pointing upwards; flame on left shoulder; earing consisting of three elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast ornament (only upper part visible); double ridged border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 2 h l. i. hwkd wld' š| hukay Walaxš| “The good king Walkash”, barbarized
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; in front of them bust with stylized crown of Walkash to the right; alter flames, depicted with vertical strokes; star to the left of altar flames, crescent to the right; to the left and the right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Walkash holding barsom in their hands, right hand raised, both figures facing inwards; no legend at 9 h; ridged border
